_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Mechanical Integrity Audit, total refrigeration inspection, all components.
_prev_prog_3.Description: Hopkins Distribution Co. LLC currently contracts with Palen-Kimball to operate and maintain the anhydrous ammonia refrigeration system. Hopkins Distribution Co. LLC has developed a Process Safety Management (PSM) program for this process.  The PSM program was modeled after the Process Safety Management Guidelines for Ammonia Refrigeration guidance document by the International Institute for Ammonia Refrigeration (IIAR).  The PSM program will serve as the Prevention program.  Hopkins Distribution Co. LLC developed an Emergency Action Plan (EAP) for the ammonia refrigeration system initially in 1990 and that plan currently remains in effect.  The EAP was most recently updated on 10/28/2012.  Palen-Kimball is prepared to respond to accidental releases to the extent allowable under the established emergency response procedures.  Hopkins Distribution Co. LLC and Palen Kimball have utilized the What If/Checklist technique endorsed by the IIAR in analyzing the process hazards associated with anhydrous ammonia.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



Hopkins Distribution Co. LLC is commited to the protection of its employees, the greater community and the environment from any hazardous substances used in the refrigerated warehouse operation, specifically the anhydrous ammonia used in the refrigeration process.  It is the policy of Hopkins Distribution Co. LLC to comply with all Federal, State and Local laws.



Facility Description and Regulated Substance Handled



Hopkins Distribution Co. LLC owns and operates a refrigerated warehouse freezer facility at 101 Jefferson Avenue South.  This facility is located in Hopkins, Minnesota.  The refrigeration systems at this facility uses anhydrous ammonia in a  closed circuit charge configuration.  The total amount of anhydrous ammonia at the freezer facility is estimated to be 69,660 pounds.  This Risk Management Plan (RMP) covers only the freezer facility since it is over the threshold of 10,000 pounds established by the EPA.  The refrigeration systems are operated and maintained by Palen-Kimball, a contractor who specializes in anhydrous ammonia refrigeration systems.





General accidental Release Prevention Program



Through completion of this RMP, Hopkins Distribution Co. LLC has complied with all EPA requirements under 40 CFR 68.  Process safety information and operations/maintenance procedures are documented on site.  Periodic functions such as process hazard analysis, training, change management and incident investigation are conducted on a regular basis.  Audits of the overall RMP are conducted on a regular basis to assure compliance with EPA regulations.



Five-Year Accident History



Hopkins Distribution Co. LLC has not had an ammonia accident causing deaths, injuries, environmental or property damage, evacuations, or in-place sheltering in the last five years at the freezer facility.



The Emergency Response Program



Hopkins Distribution Co. LLC has developed an Emergency Action Plan to

deal with accidental ammonia releases.  In the event of an emergency, it is the policy of Hopkins Distribution Co. LLC to notify the local (City of Hopkins) Fire Department and to evacuate all employees from the facility.  Palen-Kimball is prepared to respond to accidental releases to the extent allowable under the established emergency response procedures.
